name: ExperienceTO: Runnymede Historical Tour
description: Join us for a public tour that will be a good experience for anyone; whether you're 8 or 80 years old, and whether you're a curious local, solo traveler, backpacker, part of a small groups of friends, or a newcomer.

name: The Heart Has Not Stopped
description:
Artist reception November 8 from 1 to 3 pm

Grace Wang's exhibition is an intensely personal journey into the quiet mysteries of nature and existence. Through dreamlike, layered images created with in-camera multiple exposures on film, Wang evokes fleeting moments of memory and time — an intimate meditation on a world both beautiful and unknowable.

name: Canadian Photographs: 1950 – Present | A Group Exhibition
description:
Recent events have encouraged Canadians to reflect on the significance of our country. When we think of the places, people, and events that have shaped our collective memory, photographs often come to mind. In support of this reflection and to inspire deeper appreciation, we present a selection of works that highlight the evolution of photography over the past seventy-five years and its important role in documenting history.

This exhibition primarily features photographs taken in Canada. Organized chronologically, the exhibition includes original examples by photographers who exhibited in camera club salons during the 1950s and 1960s, and explores the continuing influence of documentary practice from that period to the present. It also traces the rise of photography accepted as art, and its growing prominence.

name: Season of Celebration at Scarborough Museum
description:
Join Scarborough Museum for a Season of Celebration! Embrace the spirit of light, love, and joy through a series of family-friendly activities centered on food, culture, and storytelling.  

Enjoy gingerbread decorating, family-friendly winter crafts and weekly workshops led by guest facilitators, including chair yoga, henna and more! See additional listings for more details. 

Community Feature: Sample a rotating selection of warm drinks and finger foods from around the world, curated by the Scarborough Museum Youth Collective and participants of Scarborough Museum's Newcomer Storytelling Circles. Try something new or enjoy an old favourite, learn more about the stories behind these sips and bites, and share your own stories of light and warmth in our community jar!  

Treats will be available first come-first served, while quantities last.

name: Saturday Farmers Market at Evergreen Brick Works

location.name: Evergreen Brick Works Winter location: TD Future Cities Centre

description: Toronto's largest year-round farmers market supporting local Ontario farmers and small businesses.

name: Evergreen Brick Works Farmers Market
description:
Discover Toronto's largest farmers market! 

Shop fresh, seasonal produce, artisanal goods, and locally prepared foods from Ontario farmers and small businesses.

Looking for the perfect winter weekend? Stroll through our market filled with delicious food and one-of-a-kind finds, sip on a cozy hot chocolate or coffee, and discover the history of the old brick factory on our free guided tours. Wrap it up with a peaceful walk on the outdoor trails or enjoy our ice rink. Make this your winter escape, all in one place!

By supporting the farmers market, you're helping to sustain local agriculture and small businesses. Bring your friends, family, and reusable bags for a fun and sustainable shopping experience!

name: I am Scarborough - Installation at Scarborough Museum
description:
"I Am Scarborough" is a community-engaged installation at Scarborough Museum, created by artist Kseniya Tsoy during her Toronto Arts Council Animating Historic Sites residency.

Over the course of several months, Scarborough residents and museum visitors came together to fold hundreds of origami butterflies and share their stories—their journeys, the lands their families come from, and their hopes and dreams.

Now gathered and suspended in flight, these butterflies embody the vibrant diversity of Scarborough—soaring high and envisioning a bright, shared future.

Experience their collective flight at Scarborough Museum through February 26th, 2026.

name: The Far Side of the Moon
description:
Borders divide, the cosmos unites.

Canadian legend Robert Lepage returns to Canadian Stage after sold-out productions of 887 and Needles and Opium.

Set against the Cold War's fierce U.S.-Soviet rivalry, this gripping story explores the personal and political turmoil of an era defined by global tension with a uniquely Canadian perspective. Through the tale of two Quebec City brothers, Lepage's stunning use of multimedia and visual storytelling draws the audience into a world on the brink of change and portrays the impact of global conflict on the individual.
